text: <!channel> any experienced pilots willing to give me some hints/tips next time in Portland?  I can bring down my micro drone
While Josh and I are far from being super experienced we have some pointers we can give. :slightly_smiling_face:
There is a meetup happening every month that actual drone pilots attend. Next meetup is Dec 8th. <http://www.meetup.com/PDXDrones/|www.meetup.com/PDXDrones/>
you could also fly the big/company drone. everything happens very slowly with it
Also I offer my drone as sacrifice if you want to try. (Josh and I have both crashed it... very hard) I have essentially unlimited frame parts for it now.

nice.  i've been practicing the out and back in my backyard, but don't feel like i have much room to practice changing orientation...not sure if there's a technical term for left is now right, forward is now back and the ensuing brain gymnastics it takes to not fly into the neighbors yard with the not so nice dog
Haha. Definitely our 3DR Solo helps with that.
Very slow and not likely to crash.
